nodes.text: A locked door. It says "Locks" on it. Seems appropriate to me.
I'm supposed to go in there to practice my lockpicking skills, but I might need to practice just to get inside!

nodes.message: Allowing Shawn to knock multiple times; he'll get the same response.

nodes.text: Well, if anyone is in there, maybe they can just let me in.

nodes.message: Doing these as simple conversations, but we could expand it to include Skill checks (charm, smarts, etc) or Rep checks to actually let Shawn in if he succeeds.

nodes.text: I guess no one is in there right now.
Hello? Who's there?
Hey Thomas! It's Shawn! I seem to have lost my key... can you let me in?
I'm sorry, Shawn, but I believe Master Urwald meant for each of us to pick the lock to gain access this room.
But how can I practice and actually learn to pick locks without access to the lock room?
All I can say is that if you can't pick the lock on the door, there's little this room will be able to offer you but more frustration. I'd suggest you find a good book in the library on the matter.
Yes? Who is there?
Esme! It's Shawn! I'm a bit stuck out here... can you open the door?
You still can't manage the lock Shawn? You really need to study the book about lockpicking. It's in the library.
Oh, Thomas... you're in there too?
Silly Shawn, ve can't just let you in - that vould be cheating.
Yeah. Some of us worked really hard to get in here, you can't just get a free pass.
Who is it?
Hey Katie! It's Shawn! Would you let me in?
You still have trouble with that lock? It's the simplest one!
Geez, weren't you the one trying to tell me how to pick locks? And now you can't even make it in here yourself?
I just though maybe you could save me the trouble...
You know I can't just let you in. If the Master found out, we'd both get in trouble.
Yes? Is someone there?
Hi Esme. Think you could open the door for me?
Are you skulking out there again? Vhy don't you just learn how to pick the lock like you are supposed to?
We still can't let you in here, Shawn. You really should study up in the Library.
Even I can get in here without much trouble now. You're really just being lazy at this point.
Just pick the lock like you're meant to. It's easier than trying to convince anyone to let you in.
If you are meant to be in here, I expect you can manage to open the door yourself.
I guess no one is in there right now.

nodes.message: Adding these to fit the situation best I can, but maybe be off slightly.

nodes.text: I don't hear anything.
I can't really make it out, but there are some minor noises in there. Perhaps someone is practicing with their Thieves' Tools?
There! It is done. You see? It is not hard to learn. You just need practice.
You make it look so easy, Esme.
Come on... just a little more... ugh. Why won't you just open?!
You look like you really enjoy disarming traps, Thomas.
Yes, Thomas. You are alvays so serious, but when you are vorking on that trap I think I see a bit of a smile, no?
Well, I do find disarming traps to be quite fun and mentally engaging.
It's eerily quiet in there... quiet enough to make me wonder if Master Urwald could be trying to listen through the door as well.
I'm sure I have better things to do than listen to the hallway. However, Herr O'Conner, you have an unfortunate tendency to talk to yourself out loud. Not a good trait for a rogue...
R-right... sorry, sir.
I don't hear anything.
I can't tell if anyone is in there or not.
I don't have the time to search in other rooms right now. Hopefully, whatever I'm searching for is hidden around here somewhere.

nodes.message: Currently this should never be getting hit... see comment on Pick Lock below

nodes.text: It seems the door automatically relocks itself when it shuts. How... convenient.
What do you know? The door to the lock room is locked. Great.
I guess I'll need to find some lockpicks to get in here.
I don't have the time to search in other rooms right now. Hopefully, whatever I'm searching for is hidden around here somewhere.
It's getting late. I'm too tired to mess around in the Locks Room.
I really don't want to disturb Master von Urwald during a test. It could be hazardous to my grade.

nodes.message: Not removing the locked tag here so the door always requires picking the lock - an idea that stems from Lori saying the room should "always" be locked and plays well into the events I've added above and gets around the weird "why is it locked when people are inside?" issue. I also think it adds a bit of mystique - I just hope it doesn't become frustrating.

nodes.text: I'm in!
I just can't seem to get it.
